output_list.reason: PayWinner function generates predictable random value, allowing attackers to always win the lottery.

MorphToken function relies on the owner address as a constant, allowing attackers.  Using the owner's balance to halt the game gives the owner control over the game's outcome, potentially favoring their own financial interests.
Integer overflow in payWinner function allows unauthorized user to set the balance of the contract.
The PayWinner function logic is incorrect, allowing attackers.  to always win the lottery.
The owner's address is used as a constant in the MorphToken function, allowing unauthorized users to change the owner's address and gain control over the game.
The PayWinner function uses bad random logic, allowing unauthorized users to manipulate the lottery outcome.
